thread.title: Women decorate their manicures with cannabis leaves | Daily Mail Online
thread.title_full: Women decorate their manicures with cannabis leaves | Daily Mail Online

author: Unity Blott For Mailonline
title: Women decorate their manicures with cannabis leaves | Daily Mail Online
text: Share this article Share 'Just as how glamourising alcohol drinking to a young audience could have negative effects on levels of teenage drinking, directing something which glamourises cannabis use at young people is also inadvisable,' he told FEMAIL. Kelsey wrote: 'First attempt at using real weed for gel nails', offsetting her cannabis-coated thumb and ring finger with a glossy black nail polish Instagram user Nikki NuNu Baaatch shared this picture with her 500+ followers, writing: 'Tried gluing the weed on tips lol ill [sic.] post all of the different ways I tried #weednails' Melbourne's Deadly Nails salon, famous for using dead insects like scorpions, have embedded cannabis into acrylic nails to keep up with increased demand for 'weed nails' 'The difference here is, where teenagers can't access alcohol due to age restrictions in shops, a drug dealer won't ask for ID, and is happy to sell to younger, vulnerable people. 'The risks of glamourising cannabis while it is an uncontrolled illegal substance remain greater.' The 'weed nails' trend, thought to be linked to the recent legalisation of marijuana in a clutch of US states, has recently found its way across the pond and is now gaining momentum in the UK and across the world with almost 3,000 Instagram photos tagged under #weednails. The trend, which began in 2016, has quickly gained momentum of late with almost 3,000 Instagram posts tagged using the hashtag #weednails California-based nail technician Laura Coté called this creation 'nude nails with a lil life'. She has also championed so-called 'marijuana manis' in pictures posted to social media Laura Coté also added this picture of a recent client, writing: 'Ganja girls tip the best,' adding: 'Whole leaf encapsulation now available' Instagrammer Nikki NuNu Baaatch recently shared a picture with her 500+ followers, writing: 'Tried gluing the weed on tips lol ill [sic.] post all of the different ways I tried #weednails'. Some appear to have crushed up the drug and mixed it with glue or clear varnish, while others have glued entire leaves to their acrylic nails. Cannabis is a Class B drug in the UK, meaning possession alone could result in up to five years in prison, an unlimited fine or both. Social media user Juliette Faer, who goes by KittyOfCannabis, posted this photo last week which appears to show her holding a joint, with the caption #ganjagirls #realweedacrylics This salon said their client was delighted with their 'cannabis encapsulated nails', posted to Instagram earlier this week Manicurist Raquelle Pitts, known as nailedby_rock, was keen to show off this 'weed nails' design for a recent client, decorating her cannabis manicure with glitter and rhinestones KristinasCustomNails adorned this manicure with what appears to be tiny cannabis leaves, gold glitter and green polish Evon Vuong, owner of Le'von Nail Spa, had an intricate take on the weed nails trend using glitter and tiny gold leaves. One follower commented: 'Those are badassery at its f***ing finest' German Instagrammer Katja Märtens posted this picture announcing she was 'in love with my nails' - and alongside her cannbis-tipped talons she added a picture of her pet dog Share or comment on this article Most watched News videos
